original_title: Sri Lanka developing law for nuclear power plants: Minister
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka is developing a legal framework for nuclear power, which is required to call for formal expressions of interest, though some proposals have been received, Energy Minister Kanchana Wijesekera said.
“We need a legal framework before we go into a process,” Minister Wijesekera told parliament.
“We will be calling EOIs once the legal framework is ready and we have an understanding of what our requirements are.”
“The Atomic Energy Agency, the international agencies are all helping us to identify the best technology that is needed.”
President Ranil Wickremesinghe has already given a policy decision that new technology should be included in long term generation plans for the electricity, he said.
“But when we are going to implement and how we are going to implement is still in discussion,” Minister Wijesekera said.

“We have not committed to any country or any party on developing a nuclear power plant here in Sri Lanka. We have got many proposals. That will be evaluated in due course first we need the legal structure in place.”
